name: acclivity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an upward slope; the fact of sloping upward: The village was in a vale between two gentle acclivities.
More examplesFewer examplesI left the wooded valley and proceeded to mount the steep acclivity of Wildfell.This mountain looks a monster, its very steep acclivities soaring skyward in terraces of uncompromising cliffs.Behind the church, and sloping up a gentle acclivity, was its capacious burying-ground.He encompassed the city with a wall, and made use of the acclivity of the place for making its fortifications stronger.
